attributes.action: The Government to publish an impact assessment on its Brexit deal with the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Impact assessments are common pieces of government work that determine the economic effects of policies. In October, Britain published such a review of its new trade accord with Japan, which replaced an existing deal the country had through its membership of the EU.

All above information taken from The New European 
https://www.theneweuropean.co.uk/brexit-news/westminster-news/boris-johnson-wont-publish-brexit-deal-impact-assessment-7316868
attributes.background: In November, the Office for Budget Responsibility said a free-trade deal with the EU would leave Britain’s gross domestic product 4% lower over the long run, compared with staying in the bloc. That prediction was made before the deal was agreed.

rejection.details:
You might like to sign the following petition:

Publish an Impact Assessment of the new UK-EU relationship
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/574793
